pageContext.claim: “The mayor of Minneapolis was -- it was disgraceful when I watched that. When I saw cops fleeing a precinct. There's no reason in a million years that should have been done. And we took that mess, that was a total mess. We brought in the National Guard, we took care of it. Now it's very good.”
pageContext.analysis: The Minneapolis police did make an unprecedented decision to abandon the 3rd Precinct building on the night of May 28 during riots over the killing of George Floyd. But Trump falsely takes credit for sending in the National Guard. Deploying the Guard is up to the state governors, not the president. Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) already had sent the National Guard to Minneapolis earlier on May 28 when Trump called him and offered to send in the military, according to WCCO CBS Minnesota. The police made a tactical decision to abandon the 3rd Precinct building during the riots, and Walz ordered the National Guard to reclaim the building the next day.
